availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Colbert B. Johnson (Boone County, Kentucky, merchant and postmaster.)

body.p: Boone County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah W. Johnson. Father of James A. Johnson, Mary S. Johnson, Frances E. Johnson, George B. Johnson and Caroline E. Johnson. Merchant in Boone County, Kentucky in 1850. Postmaster in Hamilton, Boone County from April 16, 1850 to March 14, 1857. Merchant in Boone County in 1860. Postmaster in Hamilton, Boone County from July 18, 1862 to October 6, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, District 2, p. 143B.
